resource.chars:
With regard to the first point - I do not see how 
the minute “germinating particles” are to make 
their way through the sarcolemma into the 
interior of the muscular fasciculi -
Nor does there appear to me to be any 
good evidence that the vermiform bodies 
are identical with the encysted bodies. The 
peculiar reniform corpuscles characteristic 
of the former indeed seem so far as I can gather from 
Mr Rainey’s account to be entirely absent 
in the latter -
Secondly, Mr Rainey does not appear to be personally acquainted with those elaborate 
researches of Kuchenmeister, Stein, Von Siebold 
and others, which bear directly upon the 
question of the origin of Cysticercus - nor with 
those of Van Beneden, Guido Wagener &c
by which so much light has been lately thrown 
upon the nature of the Cystic Entozoa in general 
The <s>direct<\s> development of the embryo Taenia into 
a Cysticercus has been directly observed by Stein;
<s>[text?]<\s> and Meissner, by discovering the six hooks of the embryo Taenia attached to the 
base of the vesicle of Cysticercus has <s>demonstrated <\s> afforded additional 
proof that the embryo Taenia passes <u>directly <\u> into
